so.”

And on the morrow Justine died. Elizabeth’s heart-rending eloquence failed to move the judges from their settled conviction in the criminality of the saintly sufferer.
passionate and indignant appeals were lost upon them. And when
received their cold answers, and heard
these men, my purposed avowal died away on my lips. Thus
might proclaim myself a madman, but not revoke the sentence passed upon

the scaffold as a murderess!

From
turned to contemplate the deep and voiceless grief of my Elizabeth. This also was my doing! And my father’s woe, and the desolation of
late so smiling home—all was the work of
thrice-accursed hands! Ye weep, unhappy ones;
heart is light<lb n="c56-0107__main__14"/>ened. The innocent
these are not your last tears! Again shall you raise <pb n="74" xml:id="F1831_v_090"/>the funeral wail, and

sound of your lamentations shall again

consoled."<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0107__main__17"/>Amiable<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0107__main__d2e22728"/>Sweet<del eID="c56-0107__main__d2e22728"/>
early, much-loved friend; he who would spend each vital drop of blood for
sakes—who has no thought nor sense of joy, except
countenances—who would fill the air with blessings,

<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0107__main__d2e22737"/>&<del eID="c56-0107__main__d2e22737"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0107__main__d2e22740"/>gentle tone<del eID="c56-0107__main__d2e22740"/>
spend his life in serving you—he bids you weep—to shed countless tears; happy beyond his hopes, if thus inexorable fate be satisfied,
if the destruction pause before the peace

grave have succeeded to your sad torments!

Thus spoke my prophetic soul, as, torn by remorse, horror, and despair, I beheld those
loved spend vain sorrow upon the graves
endured.
VOL. I.<head eID="novel1_letter4_head6"/><milestone n="2" unit="volume"/><milestone n="2" type="start" unit="frontmatter"/><milestone n="2" type="end" unit="frontmatter"/>
William and Justine, the first hapless victims to my unhallowed arts.
